Package docreader.range

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    RequirementReaderI
    Interface for all classes which deal with textual requirements
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    FigureReader
    Extracts "pseudo floating" figures from the input document These figures usually have the following structure: a paragraph consisting of nothing but an image-reference (= a special character sequence).
    RangeReader
    Abstract reader for ranges in the document
    RequirementReader
    Reads an a single or "complex" (i.e.
    RequirementReader.FigureCandidateDeterminer
    Simple immutable data store for a tuple indicating the positions if the image placeholder char and the associated caption
    RequirementReader.FigureCandidateDeterminer.FigureCandidateData  
    RequirementReaderRange
    Reader for arbitrary ranges which may need to be split into several paragraphs; supports nested structures
    RequirementReaderTextual
    Reader for requirements which are non-floating (no figures, no tables); does not support nested structures (i.e. this will always create exactly one requirement no matter how lengthy / complex the input is)
    SkipReader
    Reader which skips certain unnecessary stuff
    TitleReader
    Reads the very beginning of any requirement document, specifically its title
    TOCReader
    Reader for a "Table of Contents"
